verbs.description: untrill (third-person singular simple present untrills, present participle untrilling, simple past and past participle untrilled)

entries.meaning: (transitive, phonetics) To remove the trill from.
examples: Even in such a language as German some one must have begun to make his [r]  into a back sound, and to untrill it, and it was only gradually that the change spread through whole communities.
